query.queryString: (/article/relations/categories/collection/code='resultsPack,projectsInfoPack,brief' OR (/result/relations/categories/collection/code='deliverable,publication' OR contenttype='project')) AND ('SUSTAINABILITY' OR 'INNOVATION' OR 'MULTI-CRITERIA')

result.title: Lusatia Case study Report
result.description: The research activities carried out in Lusatia are aimed at developing a case study on the area. The case studies will be carried out in parallel in each area and will be articulated in a set of subtasks corresponding to the research activities developed in WP2.

result.title: Policy Brief
result.description: The preparation of some policy briefs is foreseen throughout the life span of the project not only to present and detail the resulting recommendations (at a regional and European level), but also to incentivise dialogue at the policy level. 15 evidence-based Policy Briefs are planned to be developed throughout the project lifespan (1 for each case study and other 2 or 3 on specific issues emerging from the project results, e.g. gender, migration, deterritorialisation, populism).

result.title: Outline of Ideas for SSH cross-disciplinary work
result.description: This Outline will be focused on the study of the clean energy transition and will be addressed to both SSH and STEM scientist working on the clean energy transition, with a particular focus on the issue of coal and carbon-intensive regions. A draft version of the guidelines will be produced by M32 and circulated among partners for suggestions and revisions.

result.title: Gender Analysis Report
result.description: A horizontal analysis of the 13 case studies will be carried out with the specific focus of putting together all the observations related to differences between man and women in the different variables of the research. The results of the analysis will be summarised in a Gender Analysis Report.

result.title: Knowledge co-production report
result.description: The report is written on the basis of a “Catalogue of interpretations” collecting observations on the visions, point of views and interpretations of all the players involved in the research (policy makers, regional stakeholders, regional stakeholder board, outside Europe mirroring Regions, etc.). The collection will start in M13 and will end in M30. This report will critically reflect on the context the project has created in which participants at various levels and with different backgrounds have come to know what it is we need to do to drive the transition to clean energy for Europe’s coal and carbon-intensive regions.

result.title: Project website
result.description: The project website will be designed as a standard tool to keep the interested stakeholder groups updated on the developments of the project including the project objectives expected impacts and other information about the consortium The main aim of establishing a web platform is to extend dissemination of the project findings to a wider audience both during and after the project implementation period Also an intranet section will be included on the website

result.title: Setting up the OIE and integrating services
result.description: Fraunhofer (with support of NTUA, IRES and UNIROMA3) determines and report the OIE technical specifications, in terms of hardware and software components to provide the best experience for both end users and developers in terms of ease of access, robustness, long-term maintainability, and sustainability.

result.title: Current climate: Flood risk and sea ice simulations for different storylines
result.description: This deliverable is a report that describes the results from a modelling exercise to simulate flood risk for different storylines assuming the current climate IVM Task 73 This includes both direct damages to European coastal infrastructure and indirect economic effects from storm surges In addition changes in sea ice extent scenarios will be used to assess the effect on shipping routes using a CGE model CCMC Task 73 Economic impacts of the European level NUTS2 will be presented and compared with the national scale analysis for the UK using the innovative UK Future Flood Explorer FFE SPL Task 73

result.title: Stakeholder dialogues
result.description: 3 2 Stakeholder Dialogues: The aim of the dialogues is to disseminate the project (interim) results. To this end, a selected target audience composed of cities, local private adaptation stakeholders (utilities, businesses, industry, etc.) will be invited to participate. The attendance of two representatives from each tier-2 city will be financed by the project consortium. Invited to these Stakeholder Dialogues will be rather targeted actors that can act as multipliers in disseminating the project results. [M20-M24/ M32]

result.title: Policy guideline
result.description: Policy guideline for the implementation of adaptation options: guideline proposing a standard approach to the design of implementation strategies for climate adaptation at the city level, according to legal, technical, financial and governance implications. (Tecnalia, TNO, Fraunhofer, EIVP, NEN, Bratislava - M40)

result.description: Report on the use case realisation for the IVAVIA tool, including feeding data and scenario story line information from one or more suitable use cases into the IVAVIA tool and performing functional tests of IVAVIA tool (Report, Software, Other).

result.title: Standardisation options
result.description: Study report on standardisation options of impact and vulnerability analysis of vital infrastructures and built-up areas. This report will be integrated in D5.1. As requested in the first periodic review we will pay attention to the assessment of existing legal requirements in Member states which could potentially act as barriers for a widespread application of the RESIN toolbox.

result.title: 2-tier webinars
result.description: 4 ‘2-tier webinars’: These webinars will connect the core cities to their tier-2 circle of learning to further share results and encourage exchange. The timing of the webinars will be aligned with the completion of the deliverables in WP 2, 3 and 6. [M30-M32]

result.title: City assessment report
result.description: A city assessment report will be compiled by ICLEI. Cities and their local research partners will be responsible for providing data on the state of the art of their resilience building activities, management processes and governance structures with regard to key infrastructure stakeholders. The report will present single in-depth city assessments that will inform the assignment of each of the cities to the different products and tools to be tested.
